clues.text: Based on qualities like color & texture, this U.S. government department divides wheat into 7 market classes
The name of these facilities where wheat is stored, cleaned & graded is from the Latin for "lifted up"
Of common, geiger, durum or einkorn, the one that's not a species of wheat
The primary wheat-growing area in South America is this fertile Argentine plain
In the mid-1900s scientists led this worldwide "revolution" to boost wheat production in the third world
He's the Virginian who wrote the Virginia Statute for Religious Freedom (he's better-known for a declaration)
In 1915 he laid the cornerstone of Arlington National Cemetery's Memorial Amphitheater
The largest species of American elk is named for him
H.L. Mencken said this president's use of language reminded him "of stale bean soup" & dubbed it "Gamalielese"
This president declared that "Any invasion of Formosa would have to run over the 7th Fleet"
The Olympians came to rule after these earlier gods were banished to Tartarus
When Zeus played follow the Leda, he did it in the form of this bird & seduced her
One of these, like those from the garden of the Hesperides, was awarded by Paris in his famous judgment
In Greek myth these lustful forest gods who were part goat attended Dionysus
After learning that she married her own son Oedipus, this queen hanged herself

A minister, 1968:
"I've seen the promised land...and I'm happy tonight...I'm not fearing any man"

A Communist, 1938:
"Political power grows out of the barrel of a gun"

A physicist, 1955:
"If only I had known, I would have become a watchmaker"

A governor, 1963:
"Segregation now! Segregation tomorrow! Segregation forever!"

A professor, 1967:
"Turn on,
tune in,
drop out"
"Soul Train" premiered in this decade
Oh yessssssss...he created the show & was the original producer & host
White crossover artists featured on "Soul Train" have included David Bowie & this "Island Girl" singer
This hair care product was among the first major backers of the show
To gain better production values, "Soul Train" was moved from this city to Los Angeles

It's the smallest in area of the Benelux countries
The fertile plain east of the Danube, making up half this country's area, is called the Great Alfold

This common weed seen here has a beverage in its name
This plant whose alkaloids ended Socrates' life now grows on American roadsides
This fabric follows Queen Anne's in the name of the weed seen here
In the names of weeds, this old word for a plant follows soap- & St. John's
In "Peanuts", Snoopy often fancied himself a flying ace out to get this pilot
Excessive bureaucratic procedure resulting in inaction or delay
Stephen Crane wrote, "He wished that he, too, had a wound," this
In song, just "remember" this place "and the cowboy that loves you so true"

clues.text: This show which had a 9-year-run on ABC was produced with help from J. Edgar Hoover

Organization that employed Alexander Waverly, Mark Slate & Illya Kuryakin

clues.text: The emblem of St. Lawrence, it's also a nickname for a football field
The first American citizen canonized was an immigrant from this country
Saint Brigid was buried at Kildare, but was later moved to be buried with this saint
Philip of Moscow foresaw that his post as primate of the Russian church might lead to martyrdom, as this man was czar
